comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The churches at right are still around. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trinity_Church_(New_York_City) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Paul's_Chapel_(New_York,_New_York) The Parkhurst church was built with a dome (Byzantine and Greek in look rather than Gothic) because a steeple would have been dwarved by the surrounding buildings, according to NYT of March 5, 1904 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9903E1D71530E132A... It was demolished after relatively few years. See NYT, September 28, 1919. MILLON DOLLAR BUILDING TO REPLACE PARKHURST CHURCH ON MADISON AVENUE; Eighteen-Story Structure Being Built by Metropolitan Life Insurance Company Will Be Connected with Main Building by Bridge Across Twenty-fourth Street query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E02E0DD1738EF31A...
